svcsubproc.title: Passenger Door Control Panel- Electric
svcsubproc.para: The electric passenger door opener is standard on all CE 200 and CE 300 buses. Optional air operated and manual openers are also available. Prior to doing any work on the electric door mechanism disconnect the power supply, and set the manual override switch to emergency position.

step1.para: The electric door opener drive mechanism is located in the compartment directly over the passenger entry door.

step2.para: To access the mechanism, rotate the door latch locking device and lift the door up.
Disconnect the power to the drive mechanism, locate the harness plug at the forward section of the door mechanism compartment. Disconnect the harness plug.

figure.caption: Figure 149. Electric Door Opener Harness Disconnect

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. ELECTRIC PASSENGER DOOR OPENER HARNESS CONNECTOR

step1.para: To remove the door hardware from the drive mechanism:

step2.para: Locate the drive arm mounting lock nut on the main gear drive plate.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. DRIVE ARM ATTACHMENT STUD AND NUT

step2.para: Loosen and remove the lock nut from the drive arm assembly and main gear drive plate.
Remove the drive arm assembly end.

step1.para: To remove the entire electric drive mechanism:

step2.para: Locate the six mounting bolts on the motor drive assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 151. Door Opener Electric Drive Motor Remove

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. ELECTRIC DOOR OPENER DRIVE GEAR ASSEMBLY
3. ELECTRIC DOOR OPENER ASSEMBLY MOUNTING BOLT HOLES
4. ELECTRIC DOOR MANUAL / AUTOMATIC ACTUATION SWITCH
5. DRIVE ARM ATTACHMENT MOUNTING STUD AND NUT

step2.para: Loosen and remove the mounting bolts, and lift the drive motor out of the compartment.

step1.para: To remove door opener connecting rods:

step2.para: The main drive arm from the electric door drive mechanism is attached to the door bracket assembly. Main drive arm is a swivel joint attachment connection with lock nut and washer at the door drive mounting bracket. The door drive mounting bracket is located at the top of the forward door panel, and is mounted with two mounting bolts into the door assembly.

The rear door assembly of the passenger entry doors is connected utilizing a drive arm with swivel joints connected to the forward door bracket. The rear door drive arm is connected to a bracket mounted on the upper frame of the rear door panel of the main passenger entry doors. This bracket is mounted to the door frame assembly with two mounting bolts.
The door opener drive rods have swivel joints at each and are secured to the brackets with lock nuts and washers at each end.
The doors are equipped with a mounting bracket with mounting points for the drive arm ends and swivels.
